dataset.title: Dataset: Study of total economic valuation of the main services provided by mangroves in the Gulf of Chiriquí, Panama
dataset.abstract: This field inventory data was collected by CATIE (Centro Agronómico Tropical de Investigación y Enseñanza) with funding provided by MarViva Foundation. In order to determine the economic value of the ecosystem service of climate change mitigation of the mangroves in the Gulf of Chiriquí, Panama, it was necessary to carry out field inventories that provide first-hand information about the amount of carbon stored in these forests. Fieldwork was carried out in the winter of 2014 across 12 mangrove sites with varying land use and anthropogenic impacts. Each site contained plots, where vegetation was surveyed and soils were sampled to provide estimates of total ecosystem carbon stock.
dataset.intellectualRights: This dataset is listed under a Creative Commons BY 4.0 and can be used with attribution. https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's family name or et al. if more than three, then publication year separated by underscores.
Code indicating what type of device was used to collect soil depth profiles.

codeDefinition.definition: A half cylinder coring device in which the coring section is open, not sealed off by a fin

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether live roots were included or excluded from carbon assessments.

codeDefinition.definition: Roots and rhizomes were separated from soil before dry bulk density and or organic matter and carbon measurements.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Temperature at which samples were dried to measure dry bulk density. This can include either samples that were freeze dried or oven dried.
Time over which samples were dried to measure dry bulk density.
Sample volume used for bulk density measurements, if held constant.
Code indicating the method for which fraction carbon was measured or modeled (Note: regression based models are permitted, but the use of the Bemmelen factor [0.58 gOC gOM-1] is discouraged).

codeDefinition.definition: Each sample presented was measured using Elemental Analysis

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether fraction_carbon refers to organic or total carbon.

codeDefinition.definition: Author specified that fraction carbon measurements were of total carbon.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any other submitter defined notes describing methodologies for determining dry bulk density, organic matter fraction, and carbon fraction.
Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's family name or et al. if more than three, then publication year separated by underscores.
Site identification code unique to each study.
Year of observation or sample collection.
Positional latitude of the core in decimal degree WGS84.
Positional longitude of the core in decimal degree WGS84.
Code indicating how latitude and longitude were determined.

codeDefinition.definition: Conventional Commercially available hand-held GPS

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any relevant submitter generated notes on how latitude and longitude were determined.
The number of the circular plot which occurs along the sampling transect within a site.
The total tree basal area in the plot.
Code indicating environmental disturbance or anthropogenic land use.

codeDefinition.definition: Mangrove where the main use consists of felling trees of the Rhizophora mangle species between 30 and 60cm in diameter, for the extraction of bark, which is marketed for the production of tannins.
Mangrove where the main use consists of felling Pelliciera Rhizophorae and Rhizophora mangle trees between 15 and 10cm in diameter for the extraction of firewood.
Sites that in the past were mangroves but were deforested and transformed into oil palm or rice crops.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Aboveground carbon, summarized for each 7m radius forest plot.
Belowground carbon, summarized for each 7m radius forest plot.
Total carbon, summarized for each 7m radius forest plot.
Aboveground carbon, summarized for each 2m radius sapling plot.
Belowground carbon, summarized for each 2m radius sapling plot.
Total carbon, summarized for each 2m radius sapling plot.
Carbon calculated from the debris pieces measured in each plot.
Carbon calculated from the understory cover in each plot.
Soil carbon calculated for the top 50 cm of the plot.
Soil carbon calculated for the top 100 cm of the plot.
Soil carbon calculated for the top 300 cm of the plot.
Total aboveground carbon for the plot, summarized across trees, saplings, fallen debris, and understory cover.
Belowground root carbon for the plot, summarized across trees and samplngs.
Total belowground carbon calculated from the root biomass and soils from 0-50 cm depth.
Total belowground carbon calculated from the root biomass and soils from 0-100 cm depth.
Total belowground carbon calculated from the root biomass and soils from 0-300 cm depth.
Total ecosystem carbon, calculated by summarizing the above and belowground carbon, down to 50 cm.
Total ecosystem carbon, calculated by summarizing the above and belowground carbon, down to 100 cm.
Total ecosystem carbon, calculated by summarizing the above and belowground carbon, down to 300 cm.
Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's family name or et al. if more than three, then publication year separated by underscores.
Site identification code unique to each study.
Core identification code unique to each site.
Minimum depth of a sampling increment.
Maximum depth of a sampling increment.
Dry mass per unit volume of a soil sample. This does not include ash free bulk density.
Soil carbon calculated as the product of the fraction carbon content, dry bulk density, and depth interval.
Percent of carbon content relative to sample dry mass.
Percent of nitrogen content relative to sample dry mass.
The number of the circular plot which occurs along the sampling transect within a site.
Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's family name or et al. if more than three, then publication year separated by underscores.
Site identification code unique to each study.
The number of the circular plot which occurs along the sampling transect within a site.
Basal area calculated for the plant, based on it's diameter.
Basal area density, calculated with respect to the plot area.
The density, or specific gravity, of the wood for a given sample (source Zanne et al. 2009).
Radius of the circular plot. A 7-meter radius plot was used to measure individuals with a DHB > 5cm, and a 2-meter radius plot was used to measure individuals with DBH < 5cm.
Species of the plant.
Family of the plant.
Diameter of the trunk or stem.
Code indicating how the diameter of the trunk or stem was measured.

codeDefinition.definition: Diameter at chest height, measured at 1.3 meters.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether the plant measured was alive or dead.

codeDefinition.definition: Plant measured was alive.
Plant measured was dead.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The decay status assigned to dead trees which are still standing (source Kauffman and Donato 2012).

codeDefinition.definition: Small branches and twigs are retained, but leaves are absent.
No twigs or small branches, and may have lost a portion of large branches.
Few or no branches, standing stem only, or may be broken-topped.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Height measurement or estimate.
Mass of plant organic matter aboveground.
Mass of plant organic matter belowground.
Aboveground plant organic matter, expressed in Mg/Ha.
Belowground plant organic matter, expressed in Mg/Ha.
Total plant organic matter, expressed in Mg/Ha.
Aboveground plant organic carbon, expressed in Mg/Ha.
Belowground plant organic carbon, expressed in Mg/Ha.
Total plant organic carbon, expressed in Mg/Ha.
Factor used to convert organic matter to organic carbon, based on the percent carbon for a given tree species or biomass component.
Any relevant notes about the plant specimen or how it was measured.
Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's family name or et al. if more than three, then publication year separated by underscores.
Site identification code unique to each study.
Code based on submitter field observations or measurement indicating dominant wetland vegetation type.

codeDefinition.definition: Herbaceous vegetation found in the understory of mangrove habitat.
Mangrove tree > 1.3m tall and under DHB < 5cm

attribute.attributeDefinition: The number of the circular plot which occurs along the sampling transect within a site.
Subplot identification code unique to each plot.
Percent of understory in the subplot.
Description of the type of vegetation surveyed.
Understory cover area, calculated as the product of the percent cover and plot area.
Biomass calculated for each subplot.
Area of subplot.
Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's family name or et al. if more than three, then publication year separated by underscores.
Site identification code unique to each study.
The number of the circular plot which occurs along the sampling transect within a site.
Transect identification code unique to each plot.
Size class of debris piece, based on its diameter

codeDefinition.definition: Downed wood with a diameter between 2.5-7.5 cm.
Downed wood with a diameter greater than 7.5 cm.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The length of transect along which downed pieces of debris were measured.
Diameter of the debris piece where it crosses the transect.
The decay status assigned to fallen pieces of wood debris.

codeDefinition.definition: Debris piece is hard, indicating higher wood density.
Debris piece is deteriorated, indicating lower wood density.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's family name or et al. if more than three, then publication year separated by underscores.
Site identification code unique to each study.
Percent of carbon content relative to sample dry mass.
Percent of nitrogen content relative to sample dry mass.
The number of the circular plot which occurs along the sampling transect within a site.
Species of the plant.
Family of the plant.
Dry weight of the vegetation sample.
Mass of plant organic matter, obtained by dividing the subsample dry weight by the subsample wet weight and multiplying by the total wet weight of the harvested sample.
Plant organic carbon of the harvested, expressed in grams.
Plant organic carbon of the harvested, expressed in Mg/Ha.
